etymology.description: 样板(樣板, model; template) + 间(間, room) = model room/showroom.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to a model room arranged to display layout, decor, or products, especially a show flat in real-estate sales offices. Lets customers experience the look and feel before deciding to buy.
etymology.simplification: 樣 → 样 simplified by streamlining the right component; 間 → 间 by replacing 門 with 门 and simplifying the interior; 板 unchanged. Overall stroke reduction under PRC simplification.

examples.chinese: 周末我们去参观新楼盘的样板间(週末我們去參觀新樓盤的樣板間)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò wǒmen qù cānguān xīn lóupán de yàngbǎnjiān.
examples.english: We’re going to visit the new development’s showroom this weekend.

examples.chinese: 销售顾问在样板间介绍户型和装修(銷售顧問在樣板間介紹戶型和裝修)。
examples.pinyin: Xiāoshòu gùwèn zài yàngbǎnjiān jièshào hùxíng hé zhuāngxiū.
examples.english: The sales consultant introduces the floor plans and finishes in the showroom.

examples.chinese: 通过样板间(通過樣板間)，买家可以更直观地了解未来的居住空间(買家可以更直觀地了解未來的居住空間)。
examples.pinyin: Tōngguò yàngbǎnjiān, mǎijiā kěyǐ gèng zhíguān de liǎojiě wèilái de jūzhù kōngjiān.
examples.english: Through the showroom, buyers can more intuitively understand their future living space.
